candidates.name: Alex Dobie
candidates.why_elect: Having served three terms as an Opotiki District Councillor from 2001-2010. I have the skills and experience necessary to be the next mayor. Married to Kararaina for 38 years, we have successfully raised three children in Opotiki. Community interests and networks and a commitment to engage and consult with all.
candidates.why_stand: I am passionate about Opotiki, and the people who live here. I see huge potential within our district. Untapped potential the challenge is about making the positive changes to enrich our lives, while ensuring the future is brighter for us all. Making Opotiki a better safer place is my goal.

candidates.name: Peter Irving
candidates.why_elect: My pakeha family have been in Opotiki since 1865, with my children and two of my mokopuna also born here. My wife's tipuna trace back to Mataatua. I intend to utilise my banking and international business experience for the betterment of the ratepayers.
candidates.why_stand: My work experience gives me a clear knowledge of this communities needs and requirements. I look forward to using this experience for the betterment of our people. It's time someone with business sense leads the council.

candidates.name: Louis Rāpihana
candidates.why_elect: I am a person who loves communicating with people, I want the people to have more of a voice in local policies and plans moving forward.
candidates.why_stand: I am standing as a candidate at the request of the people, the people want a change and I am honoured to help make that happen.

candidates.name: Lyn Riesterer
candidates.why_elect: Integrity, honesty, a good listener, a good team leader and the ability to ask the hard questions or make the tough decisions.
candidates.why_stand: I believe I am the best person for the job of leading the council moving into the next triennium. Experienced and well trained in local government procedures, rules and regulations. Ability to lead people well in a team and wanting to lead with positivity in partnership with our community.
